fields.summary: Allow For Selecting Customer Request Types When Moving Issues Between SD Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3612].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When accessing a customer portal (e.g. https://instance/servicedesk/customer/portal/1), on the top left corner of the page you have the help center icon displayed. Clicking on that icon sends you to the help center page (e.g. https://instance/servicedesk/customer/portals). 

Customers having only one service desk project (therefore only one customer portal) should have the possibility to change the help center icon link url to the only customer portal available.


\\
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customers to customize the link url for the icon displayed at the top right corner or, in case only one customer portal is available, change the link url to the one of the only customer portal available.
fields.summary: It should be possible to change the help center icon link to point to a specific customer portal in JIRA Service Desk
Portal only users get into a weird state in JIRA when anon access is given

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3609].
  {panel}

We are trying use cloud JIRA for a public bug tracker and also for support Service Desk.
We have enabled public sign-up for both JIRA and the portal.

If a user signs up to the portal first, it is impossible for them to sign-up for JIRA.  They need to go through the admin to get them to configure it.

If the user signs up to JIRA first, there is no issue as they will have access to the support portal.

As a result, I can't send new users to the portal first. I need to send them to JIRA to create an account and the direct them to the portal.
fields.summary: Self sign-up in Service Desk stops being able to self sign-up for JIRA Core/Software

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3607].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is only possible to use {{.png}} & {{.jpg}} images for request types in JIRA Service Desk. It would be useful is {{.svg}} files could be allowed as well.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow {{.svg}} images to be uploaded.

h3. Workaround 
Use {{.png}} & {{.jpg}} images.
fields.summary: Allow usage of .SVG images for request types
Need to test this
Email comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3596].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Other than vertical positioning of fields, it is not possible to make any adjustments to the layout of the create request screen for Service Desk. When working with request types that require a lot of fields to be filled in, this means the create screen can become really long stretched downwards.

h3. Suggested Solution
Being able to place fields in columns provides the option to place fields next to each other instead of under each other. This helps to create a better looking layout.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to be able to adjust the layout of the create issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3595].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an Agent, I frequently markup my responses to customers, and in doing use wiki markup that looks especially good in the JIRA view of support tickets. I always use the blue Preview button ( !preview.png|thumbnail! ) to make sure my editing looks the way I intend.

However, this does not apply to the Customer Portal view that my customer's see. Sometimes, the results are impossible for my customers to read or understand, making for a poor customer support experience.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a Customer Portal preview button, so that I can format my customer responses to show what they are seeing, so that I can build my responses in a format that's easier for my intended audience to read and more importantly understand. The Customer Portal view is so vastly different from the standard JIRA view of a support issue, that being able to see what the customer will see is essential to formatting a customer response in a way that is readable for them.
 
h3. Workaround 
I have to reformat the support issue's URL to add this: {{/servicedesk/customer/portal/XX/}} so that I can switch to the customer's view of the issue - but only AFTER it's been added to the ticket. Editing this view will result in more mail being sent to the customer, which is also not a good customer support experience.
fields.summary: Customer Portal Preview
Jira Service Desk customers have to log in to see attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3589].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create two Service Desk projects.
# Invite a customer to the first one, via the "Invite Customers" button on the Customers section of the service desk.
# Follow the invite link that's sent and sign up for an account.
# On the second service desk, send an invite to the same account.

The email from the second service desk is sent as normal, but when the user follows the link they get a "Token is either expired or not valid" error on the resulting page.

If a customer already exists in a different service desk, there should be some popup that notifies the user that this is the case, adds them to the service desk as normal, and sends a different notification to the customer to let them know they now have access to the new one (as opposed to sending another signup link).
fields.summary: Customer accounts that already exist are still sent an invite email when inviting them to a second service desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3588].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition:*
When Request Participants are added into a case, a lot of unnecessary email notifications are getting triggered to those user, which makes JSD a very annoying and noisy toll for the client that we are dealing with.

*Solution:*
We need to have the ability to disable the notifications of the Request Participants field from the Notifications Scheme like any other field.
fields.summary: Disable Notifications Triggered by Request Participants Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3587].
  {panel}

The "Setting up request types" documentation includes a section on "Hidden fields and unsupported fields" that includes a partial list of fields that cannot be shown in the portal. 

This suggestion is to update the list of fields to include all fields that cannot be shown in the customer portal. 

----

In Service Desk 3.1.2, the following fields are available in the portal: 

{quote}
* Checkboxes
** description: Choose multiple values using checkboxes.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multicheckboxes
* Date Picker
** description: A custom field that stores dates and uses a date picker to view them
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datepicker
* Date Time Picker
** description: A custom field that stores dates with a time component
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime
* Labels
** description: Add arbitrary labels to issues.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:labels
* Number Field
** description: A custom field that stores and validates numeric (floating point) input.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:float
* Radio Buttons
** description: A list of radio buttons
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:radiobuttons
* Select List (cascading)
** description: Choose multiple values using two select lists.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:cascadingselect
* Select List (multiple choices)
** description: Choose multiple values in a select list.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiselect
* Select List (single choice)
** description: A single select list with a configurable list of options.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select
* Text Field (multi-line)
** description: A multiline text area custom field to allow input of longer text strings.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea
* Text Field (single line)
** description: A basic single line text box custom field to allow simple text input.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textfield
* URL Field
** description: Allow the user to input a single URL
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:url
* User Picker (single user)
** description: Choose a user from the user base via a popup picker window.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:userpicker
* User Picker (multiple users)
** description: Choose multiple users from the user base via a popup picker window.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiuserpicker
{quote}

The following fields are not able to be added to the customer portal. These can be added to a request type if they are hidden and have a preset value.

{quote}
* Group Picker (multiple groups)
** description: Choose multiple user groups using a popup picker window.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multigrouppicker
* Group Picker (single group)
** description: Choose a user group using a popup picker window.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppicker
* Project Picker (single project)
** description: Choose from projects that the user can view in the system.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:project
* Version Picker (multiple versions)
** description: Choose from available versions in the project.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiversion
* Version Picker (single version)
** description: Choose a single version from available versions in the project.
** key: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:version
{quote}
fields.summary: Update "Setting up request types" documentation to list standard custom field types that cannot be shown in portal
There is no documentation stating the syntax to be used for the Request Types' description in JIRA Service Desk (Cloud and Server)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3583].
  {panel}

Currently when creating a knowledge base in the JSD customer portal, you can limit access to articles in a space by adding labels that can be searched by customers, as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html]:

bq.Limit the pages that will be suggested - In the Restrict to articles with label column, enter the labels that must be applied to pages in order for them to appear in the suggested page list. For example, you might want to only include pages with the label "purchasing" to appear when customers enter a "Request new software" request.

It would be helpful if users could restrict access to certain pages based on label, as well as including labels that can be searched. 

Additionally, it would be useful if the restricted labels also applied to the general search option in the customer portal so that when users search prior to submitting a ticket, results can be further filtered.
fields.summary: Restrict access to labels in JSD customer knowledgebase

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3582].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , there's no way for Collaborator to add comment via email . If collaborator username is mention in the comment , and they get the email notification . Once they replied the email notification , new issue will be created . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Let collaborator reply email notification , and the email contain add as issue internal comment .
fields.summary: Allow collaborator to add internal comment via email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3580].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* At this moment, if you are defining fields for your customer request portal, there is no option to organize the fields in tab as in JIRA. This is due to there is no screen functionality in JSD.
 !Selection_097.png|thumbnail! 
* If you are appending a large number of field for the customer request portal, the users will need to do a lot of scrolling action which is not convenient.
 !Selection_098.png|thumbnail! 
 !Selection_099.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
* To introduce tab functionality for the customer request portal
fields.summary: To introduce tab for the fields in customer request portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3579].
  {panel}

h2.Summary
Cannot invite customers from project (not user management) when email contains '&' character.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Click on the Service Desk project > People > Customers > Invite Customers
# Enter an email address with '&' (john&doe@example.com)
# Click enter

h2. Expected Results
* Email is considered valid and able to continue typing next email address or send invite

h2. Actual Results
* Unable to invite customers

h2. Current workaround
# Create the user in JIRA with this email address
{{Cog icon > User Management > Users > Create User}}
# Remove the user from *jira-users* group so that he/she won't count towards the license
# Add this user to the Service Desk Customers Role
{{Projects > ServiceDeskProject > Administration > Roles}}
fields.summary: Unable to invite customers with '&' in their email
Info box on com.atlassian.servicedesk MPAC version history is confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3575].
  {panel}

Service Desk currently allows to display image attachments embedded in the notification emails that are being sent from Service Desk.
Non-image files however can not get embedded.
In these cases, a customer is required to have access to the portal in order to fetch the files in question.
In certain situations, it will not be possible for customers to reach the portal, and all Service Desk functionality will go through email instead.
This can happen both when the customers environment does not allow access to outside networks, or if the network where JIRA Service Desk is hosted does not allow incoming traffic from outside the network.

h3. Note
File attachments on mail servers often are subject to a size restriction. If there is a mismatch between the size that Service Desk allows to get attached, and the mail server allows to process, there could surface some issues
fields.summary: Embed non-image attachments files in the notification email.
Update documentation for Editing and collaborating on issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3571].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of now, the Knowledge Base articles in a Customer Portal will open a pop-up window when it's clicked. However from the pop-up window, user has no direct link (URL) to the page. With this, users have to search the article again in Confluence should they want to share the page URL.

Screencast: http://screencast.com/t/XY4DR439ywaA

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add a link to the Confluence page for easier navigation
* Add a share option for the Confluence pages

h3. Workaround
Open the link in a new tab / window.
fields.summary: Add link to Confluence page in Knowledge Base suggestions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3565].
{panel}


{panel:bgColor=#79F2C0}
*Confluence Table of Contents macro is now supported on Jira Service Desk Cloud knowledge base *
Hi all, just want to let you all know table of content macro is now supported on Jira Service Desk Cloud. Go try it out today!{panel}
h3. 

Summary

When a Confluence KB Space is linked to a Service Desk project, the Table of Contents Macro is not displayed on any page containing the macro when viewing from the Customer Portal as a Customer.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link a Confluence KB Space to a Service Desk Project
 # Add a Table of Contents Macro to any page of the Space
 # Visit the Customer Portal directly from the Portal URL
 # Search for the page that contains the Table of Contents Macro
 # Select the Page to view it

h3. Expected Results

The page loads in a modal window and should contain all content added to the page, including the Table of Contents Macro.
h3. Actual Results

The Table of Contents Macro is omitted from the page, and all other page content works as intended.
h3. Workaround

The workaround we found is to use the Table of Contents Zone macro in the *New Confluence Editor* instead. Brief steps are as follows:

1. Add *Table of Contents Zone* to the page.
 2. Edit the macro and include the main body/text of the page is inside of the macro.
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-06 at 10.56.37 AM.png|thumbnail!

3. Save the macro and publish the page.
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-06 at 10.57.57 AM.png|thumbnail!

4. Go to the portal and search for this page.
 5. The complete page shows up including the macro output.
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-06 at 10.57.38 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Table of Contents Macro does not display on KB Pages from within the Customer Portal

  {panel}

Hello,

We use Jira for project management, time reporting and ticket management. 
Obviously, the service deck app is an important tool for my helpdesk team. We have more than one hundred accounts and most of them are big companies. 

Consequently, we have customers from different companies using the customer portal. But we are loosing times on two points due to the customer management. 

*+Creating ticket with the good account+*
When a customer open an issue through the portal, the account isn't indicated, even if I previously associated the account and the customer on the tempo settings.
How is it possible to do such a things ? 

*+Getting contact info+*
When a customer open a ticket, we have absolutly no contact info except the mail, by clicking on reporter's link. 
On the customer managament screeen, I can't indicate any contact info such as basically a phone number. 
Consequently, we need to connect on our CRM to get the contact info. Difficult for me to explain to my CEO why we take Jira rather the CRM's helpddesk tool.

Could you help on those two points making my helpdesk team happy and efficient when getting ticket from the customer portal ? 

Best regards,
Fabien Ducher

  {panel}

Our SD has multiple user directories configured. Most users (incl. customers) are managed in Active Directory. Within Active Directory we enforce a number of password rules.

When a customer has forgotten his password, he can request to reset his password, which results in the generic SD "Password Reset Request" email. If the user then clicks the link and chooses a new password that does not match our rules, this will fail, but the user does not get any explanation about what was wrong. This leads to frequent identical support request for our IT team from users that get stuck without a login.

Some improvements that could help are:
- Allow us to add custom content to the "Password reset request" email template, so that we can add a link to our password rules.
- Allow us to update the content of the "Change Password" screen, so we can add the link there.
- Improve the integration with AD to cope with custom password rules and provide user friendly errors (I'm not sure this is technically possible).
- Allow us to configure the same password rules as in AD and use these to validate password input.
fields.summary: Improve password reset requests when integrated with AD

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3540].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a user signs up for Service Desk using a specific Customer Portal URL, he is automatically added to and can begin to raise issues on any Service Desk that has customer signup enabled (i.e. all projects that have request security set to "Anyone can sign up for a customer account on my Customer Portal"). This makes it hard to configure Service Desk for scenarios where specific customers should only be able to signup and raise requests on specific portals only, while there are other portals on the same instance that will allow signup for other specific group of customers only. 

The main problem here seems to be the fact that all Service Desk projects are required to have the *Service Desk Customer - Portal Access* granted basic permissions by default e.g. Create Issue, Browse projects etc (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-3421). This makes it hard to restrict these project permissions, except of course by entirely disabling customer self-signups by using request security option: 'Only people on my customers list can raise a request').

h3. Solution
Make request security and public signup more flexible for Service Desk admins who want to allow anyone with a portal URL to be able to signup, but then to only be able to raise issues on the specific portal on which they signed up on, and no other.
fields.summary: More flexible portal-specific customer signup

  {panel}

h2.Summary

When using post function 'Update Issue Custom Field' (with {{%%CURRENT_USER%%}} macro), it doesn't add non-agent users to the Request Participant field.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Look for a dummy SD project.
# Set up an automation in the SD project that triggers status transition on comment.
# Set the automation to transition to a status (status A for example) when commented by a *non-agent* user and when the comment is *internal*.
# Set a 'Update Issue Custom Field' post function to the transition to Status A in step 3. Use {{%%CURRENT_USER%%}} macro as its value.
# Create a dummy issue and log in with a non-user agent (that has access to the dummy ticket).
# Comment on the ticket to trigger automation that transitions the ticket to Status A (which then triggers the post function to set the Request Participant field).

h2.Expected Result
The Request Participant should be set to the non-agent user that triggers the automation and post function.

h2.Current Result
The Request Participant field is set to the sysadmin instead of the non-agent user that trigger the automation and post function.
fields.summary: Post function to set Request Participant field doesn't set the value to non-agent user who triggered it

  {panel}

Jira Service Desk lacks documentation regarding resolution descriptions and best practices.  Using the default {{IT Help}} issue and resolving it, the agent is presented with an {{Issue}} option.

So, is it fairly common that help requests are resolved by filing another issue in a completely separate project for them?  I imagine so.  

However, should the customer request remain open until that issue is fixed?  That doesn't seem feasible or likely to meet an SLA.  Or, has the agent assisted the customer, sufficiently, by filing an issue on their behalf (although it may be quite some time before it is fixed).  I know this is business logic and up to Service Desk Administrators, but this is also a fairly common scenario that I've seen within Atlassian, itself.  It would be nice if there were some documentation suggesting guidelines for agents in regards to resolving requests based on filing other project issues on the customer's behalf.  

And, how will the customer ever track the status of the other issue?  Is this configurable?  Any practices that Service Desk Administrators can follow to allow the customer to see issues filed on their behalf, not just requests?
fields.summary: Service Desk lacks resolution documentation

Use case is that, a customer sends an email with an agent CC'd on the message.

*What happens now*

* Agent gets added as a Request Participant, meaning they take on the customer role for ticket

*What should happen*

* Agent remains in agent role

*How can this be done*

* Automation is a good way to do this, but will require conditions to detect WHEN a Request Participant is added, and THEN allow participant to be removed from issue

The final result, might be something like:

* WHEN request participant added
* IF User is an agent
* THEN remove user from participants
fields.summary: Provide automation conditions to allow removal of Request Participants

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3504].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The SLA is not pausing the issue when a participant comment on it on Service Desk, we made 5 tests (described on the steps to reproduce and expected results section) and what we can conclude of these tests, is that participants are treated like customers by Service Desk SLA, so they will not have the ability to stop the SLA, even if they are agents.

h3. Environment

*Cloud environment
*JIRA Cloud Version: 7.2.0-OD-03-010


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Using the Service Desk UI to open tickets as a customer, execute the following tests:

# As a customer create a ticket through customer portal and add an agent as a participant and comment on the issue as the participant.
# As an agent, add an agent as a participant and comment on the issue of a customer as the participant.
# As an Agent, comment on the issue of a customer without being participant or assignee
# As an agent, comment on the issue of a customer being assigned as participant and assignee at the same time.
# As an agent, comment on the issue of a customer being only the assignee - The SLA stops

h3. Expected Results

In all cases the SLA must stop

h3. Actual Results

# When a customer adds an agent as a participant - if the participant comment on the issue the SLA does not stop
# When an agent is added as participant by another agent - if the participant comment on the issue the SLA does not stop
# When an agent comment on the issue without being a participant or assignee - The SLA stops
# When an agent is added as participant and assignee of the issue - The SLA will not stop
# When the agent is an assignee only - The SLA stops

h3. Notes
No Notes

h3.Workaround
There is no workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: SLA does not pauses when commenting on the issue as participant

h3. Problem Definition
Currently Service Desk did not allow you to set more than two different email. When user need one email creating issues for each Request Type it will not allow him if there is more than two Reuqest Types.

h3. Suggested Solution
Possibility to add more than 2 different Cloud email address to Email requests.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Add more than 2 emails address to the Email requests
Allow service desk customers belonging to the same company to view all company tickets

h3. Problem Description

There is only one question in Satisfaction Feedback at the moment. It would be great to have a feature that can insert more questions.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to have more questions in Satisfaction Settings.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3479].
  {panel}

If I want to link issues I can use JQL to find my correct issue.

Sometimes I want to link more than 1 or two issues to my current issue. That is also possible in the link issue dialog.

There seems to be max number of 10 issue that are displayed in that dialog/popup/overlay.

It would be nice if there could be paging or scroll-bar if there are more issues than displayed.

I added a Screenshot:
JQL-Linked.jpg shows that only 10 Issues are displayed.
JQL-Search shows that there are 24 issues for the same JQL.

Kind regards
André
fields.summary: More functionality of number of issues in link issues dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3475].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Service Desk not sending any email notification when issue is Closed

As stated in this documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html
When a customer submits a request, they receive email notifications as the issue reporter when:
the request is created
a comment is added to the request
another participant is added to the request
the request is resolved with a set resolution field
the request is reopened with a cleared resolution field

So by default there will be no notification sent when the request is closed.

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA SD will send email notification to reporter when issue is Closed
fields.summary: JSD not sending email notification to reporter when issue is Closed
Display different issue status for Agents and Customers
Expose request type groups to search filters or JQL
The REST and Component representation of the Customer Request Type don't have its 'value'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3466].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When an Agent links a Confluence KB Page to a JIRA Service Desk Issue, they should have this link appear to the Customer in the Customer Portal. Currently, if an Agent uses this Feature, it is unknown to them that the Customer won't have access to see that resource, and can create confusion between the Agent and the Customer.

h3. Suggested Solution

There is currently a "Create KB article" button, but there should be a "Link to KB article" button (or some other mechanism) for already existing resources in the Knowledge Base.
 
h3. Workaround 

At the moment, the only way to link to already existing resources in the Knowledge Base is to either Wiki markup the link in a comment, or the paste the link in directly.
fields.summary: Confluence KB Page Links viewable in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3464].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Current Customer portal only can be set one language , by using translation plugin . There's no functionality to set multiple language , and the language depending on custom field value . For example , custom field called 'Locale' which contains Region information for ex: France, Italy, England etc, so language specific Customer portals for ex: Customer Portal in French language for France and English for US etc

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow language settings depending on custom field value or by Customer portal settings individually.
fields.summary: As admin , would like Customer Portal language depending on field value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3463].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, the SLA Report is restricted only in one project, hence if the Agents want to see the SLA report for each project they need to navigate between the projects. 

h3. Suggested Solution:
It will be great if there is one page that could show all SLA report across the project. It will be like a massive Wallboard where the Agents could see every SLA report for every project. Since SLAs might be re-used between projects, and can be worked on by the same set of agents, having these reports available with shared SLAs over multiple projects would add a lot of value.
fields.summary: All SLA Report across projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3462].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Attaching and commenting on an issue to a customer takes multiple steps if using the 'respond to customer' button.  Clicking on 'more' and then 'attach files' brings up a single comment and attachment interface but the 'respond to customer' dialog does not allow you to both comment and add an attachment.  If you already have an attachment on the issue there is an attachment button now present on this screen to add the attachment into the comment.  
 !attachment.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Suggested Solution

This should be streamlined into a single interface so that you can add attachments directly when responding to customer rather than causing the user to have to remember to go through a different workflow to add an attachment.
fields.summary: Simplify Attachment/Comment process into single interface

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3460].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, if an Internal User or Agent are added as a "Request Participant" on a ticket, they will not retrieve any Internal Comment of that Request.

h3. Suggested Solution:
As that behaviour is by design, it will be great if there is a feature that will prevent any Internal Users to be added as the "Request Participant" or a warning that mention that the user would not retrieve any internal comment notification.

h3. Workaround:
Remove any Internal Users from the "Request Participant" field.
fields.summary: Prevention or Warning message when Agent tries to add Internal Users as Request Participants
Update JIRA
Create and link to an issue

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently you cannot pull values to populate one field from another field.

h3. Suggested Solution

As a admin or user of the system I'd like to show/hide a field on a screen based upon options selected from another field as well as pull values from other fields.
fields.summary: Ability to display or hide a field based on option selected from another field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3456].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently request types do not allow for preset summary fields on request types. See [Receiving request by e-mail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/receiving-requests-by-email-747602718.html] and [Hidden fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html#Configuringrequesttypesandworkflows-HiddenFieldsHiddenfieldsandunsupportedfields] for reference. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
In some cases such as login password and common category request customer specified summaries aren't required. It would be useful for the summary to be able to be preset and hidden from the customer avoiding human error and a more efficient method from the customer end.
fields.summary: Preset values for Summary field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3455].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

While the documentation for [Hidden and unsupported fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html#Configuringrequesttypesandworkflows-HiddenFieldsHiddenfieldsandunsupportedfields] provide the customer with details about functionality on the feature however there aren't any clear instructions on how to configure it. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide detailed steps and perhaps a screenshot on how to configure it similar to the workaround mentioned below. As well as provide a reminder that Summary and Description are required visible fields [Recieving Request by e-mail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/receiving-requests-by-email-747602718.html].

h3. Workaround 

# Please make sure your field/custom field is associated with your JIRA Service Desk project screen scheme. See [Configuring Fields and Screens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-fields-and-screens-187859099.html] for reference.  Please follow the [create a custom field custom field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/adding-a-custom-field-185729521.html] instructions if you need to create a to new field.
# Following the steps for [Customizing fields on request types|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html#Configuringrequesttypesandworkflows-CustomizingFieldsCustomizingthefieldsonarequesttype] specify the field as hidden and provide the value on creation or after the fact. 

See screenshot for reference. 

!step2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide configuration detail field preset values on request types.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3450].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

_Create Linked Issue_ option in _Issue View Screen_ is not translated to different language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change language setting in User Profile to different language (i.e Deutsch)
# Navigate to any issues
# Click More

h3. Actual Result

_Create Linked Issue_ is not translated to _Deutsch_

h3. Expected Result

_Create Linked Issue_ is translated to _Deutsch_
fields.summary: Create Linked Issue is not translated to different language
